full_summary:
# Invitation to Tender: R and Python Training Platform

## General

* Tender Reference Number: cb-678-85931594
* Amendment Number: 4
* Solicitation Number: J069346/A
* Publication Date: 2023-11-06
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-12-19 at 14:00:00 (Eastern Standard Time)

## Request for Proposal Details

* Classification: Computer-based Training Software (UNSPSC 43232502)
* Procurement Category: Services (SRV)
* Trade Agreements: Applicable trade agreements include the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), and others.
* Solicitation Type: Request for Proposal (RFP)

## Contract Details

* Contracting Entity: Statistics Canada
* Contracting Entity Address: 150 Tunney's Pasture Driveway, Ottawa, ON K1A 0T6, Canada
* Contract Duration: One year plus four irrevocable option one-year periods
* Contract Award: Awarded to the bidder with the highest combined rating of technical merit and price

## Tender Submission

* Interested bidders may submit their proposals without prior confirmation from the Contracting Authority, unless it would not be consistent with the business requirements of efficient operations.
* Tender Submissions should be addressed to [StatsCan Tenders and Bids Directorate](mailto:tenders@statcan.gc.ca)

## Contact Information

* Name: Shuo Chen
* Email: [shuo.chen@statcan.gc.ca](mailto:shuo.chen@statcan.gc.ca)
* Phone: (343) 573-8056

## Attachment

* Tender Notice and Request for Proposal: English and French versions available at [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca)

The proposed RFP is intended to result in the award of two contracts, one for English-speaking employees and one for French-speaking employees, each for a one-year duration, with the option to extend for four additional one-year periods. Any interested bidder can compete, subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the RFP. 

Submission of tender closes on December 19th, 2023. 

Statistics Canada encourages interested firms to obtain the attached RFP for more information about the requirements and submittal procedures. 
Note that this is a Request for Proposal and not tender. */p>
